definition: not one good point/everything about it is wrong
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: If nothing else though, it gave us the honey scene.
sentences.chinese: 尽管其他一无是处，但它给我们带来了甜蜜的场景。

sentences.english: The Knesset has been debased by the executive's greater clout.
sentences.chinese: 而国会也在执政官的更大的影响下被贬的一无是处。

sentences.english: You can't be a basketcase, a girl who causes a scene or a girl who drinks too much.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一无是处，只知道大吵大闹或喝得烂醉。

sentences.english: The young men had nothing better to do than fracas in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人除了在街上吵闹，一无是处。

sentences.english: The film was rubbished by the critics.
sentences.chinese: 影评家把这部影片贬得一无是处。

sentences.english: They thought I was an otaku and good for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 例句他们觉得我就是个御宅男，一无是处。

sentences.english: I find it close to useless for everyone except HR.
sentences.chinese: 我发现它对于大家来说都近乎一无是处，除了人力部。

sentences.english: He rubbished most of the novels written by contemporary writers.
sentences.chinese: 他把大多数当代作家写的小说贬得一无是处。

sentences.english: The new editor picked her manuscript to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 新编辑把她的原稿批得一无是处。

sentences.english: These new smartphone platforms are nothing without a capable AppStore.
sentences.chinese: 这些智能手机平台如果没有应用程序存储则一无是处。

sentences.english: We (USA) are now in a position of impotency, only complaining and nibbling around the edges withfeble sanctions.
sentences.chinese: 我们美国现在一无是处，只会抱怨和实施一些小制裁。

sentences.english: Her father was dead set against her marrying that no-good Fitch.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲坚决反对她嫁给那个一无是处的菲奇。

sentences.english: I consider that their claims are worthless.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，他们的调查一无是处。

sentences.english: It was about time that Jessica got rid of that no-good boyfriend!
sentences.chinese: 也该是洁西卡甩掉一无是处的男友的时候了。

sentences.english: Early winter on the merit it?
Her boyfriend is a good - for - nothing layabout.
sentences.chinese: 她的男友是一个一无是处的懒汉。

definition: not having any special skill/without any qualifications
useless (idiom)/worthless/inept
pinyin: lan4 ni2 fu2 bu4 shang4 qiang2

definition: incompetence/inability/incapable/powerless
bad/no good/below average/disappointing
worthless (idiom)/no use whatsoever
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
not worth a penny/utterly worthless
(Cantonese) (coll.) good-for-nothing/loser
not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
weak and inept person/hopeless case
pinyin: fu2 bu4 qi3 de5 A1 dou3

definition: lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
arrogant and conceited
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
